bayou.http

Class HttpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • bayou.http.HttpServer

  • public class HttpServer
extends Object
    Http server.

    Each server has an HttpHandler which creates a response for every request.

    Configuration can be done on the HttpServerConf before server start, for example 

         HttpServer server = new HttpServer(handler);
     server.conf()
         .port( 8080 )
         .trafficDump( System.out::print )
         ;
     server.start();

    Life Cycle

    The server can be in 4 states: init, accepting, acceptingPaused, acceptingStopped.

    After start(), the server is in accepting state. New requests are accepted.

    If pauseAccepting() is called, the server is in acceptingPaused state. New requests are not accepted. This is useful to protect the server when some resources are about to be exhausted. The server socket ports are still owned by this server. The server can be resumed to accepting state by resumeAccepting().

    After stopAccepting(), the server is in acceptingStopped state. New requests are not accepted. The server socket ports are freed and can be grabbed by another server. Existing requests are still being processed. Their connections will be closed after their responses are written. Check the number of live connections by getConnectionCount().

    The stopAll() call will stop accepting new requests and abort outstanding requests.

    You can use stop(graceTimeout) to gracefully stop the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpServer

        public HttpServer(HttpHandler handler)
        Create an HttpServer.

        Equivalent to new HttpServer( new HttpServerConf(), handler ).

      • HttpServer

        public HttpServer(HttpServerConf conf,
                  HttpHandler handler)
        Create an HttpServer.

        After the constructor call, the `conf` object can be accessed through conf(), and it can be modified as long as the server is not started.

    • Method Detail

      • conf

        public HttpServerConf conf()
        Get the HttpServerConf of this server.

        Changes to configuration must be done before the server is started.

      • addUpgrader

        public void addUpgrader(String protocol,
                        HttpUpgrader upgrader)
        Add an HttpUpgrader for the protocol.

        This method must be called before the server is started.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws Exception
        Start the server. See Life Cycle.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getServerSockets

        public Set<ServerSocketChannel> getServerSockets()
        Get server sockets.

        Returns an empty set if the server is not started, or has been stopped.

      • getConnectionCount

        public int getConnectionCount()
        Get the number of connections.

      • pauseAccepting

        public void pauseAccepting()
        Pausing accepting new requests. See Life Cycle.

      • resumeAccepting

        public void resumeAccepting()
        Resume accepting new requests. See Life Cycle.

      • stopAccepting

        public void stopAccepting()
        Stop accepting new requests. See Life Cycle.

      • stopAll

        public void stopAll()
        Stop accepting new requests and abort outstanding requests. See Life Cycle.

      • stop

        public void stop(Duration graceTimeout)
        Gracefully stop the server.
        1. Call stopAccepting() to stop accepting new requests.
        2. Wait for getConnectionCount() to reach 0, within `graceTimeout`.
        3. Call stopAll().
